page.title: 17Green St.Green,Bromley,S.E.
page.content: Green Street Green is on the outer edge of the South East London suburbs bordering the Green Belt,made up of woodlands and farmland. Although it is now a suburban area it has retained some village character. It began in the last century as a small Victorian setttlement outside the suburbs of the day. The oldest part now forms a small, rather ragged,shopping centre in the High Street,where the old and new shops are mixed with some industry and housing. A modern Supermarket has been made to fit in well with the village style. The residential section has been extended from the old centre in a piecemeal fashion in the pre-war, inter-war,and post-war phases.
